complex.title: Interactive Line Chart
complex.text:
This is an interactive line chart showing COVID case counts.

Yellow, orange, and red lines represent unvaccinated people of different age groups; light, medium, and dark blue lines represent vaccinated people in the same age groups.

Your turn: Hover over the line chart to see the data for the corresponding date.

complex.title: Creating a Time Filter
complex.text:
The x-axis shows time in weeks.

You can select a subset of weeks to filter the data shown in the visualization.

Your turn: To proceed to the next step, create a selection by clicking and dragging over the time axis.

complex.title: Adjusting the Time Filter
complex.text:
You can adjust the filter either by resizing the selection (on the left or right) or by dragging the entire filter.

Your turn: Adjust the filter you have created.

complex.title: Clearing the Time Filter
complex.text: Your turn: Click on the time filter outside of the selection area (or press the 'Esc' key) to clear the filter.

complex.title: Legend
complex.text:
This is the legend. For both vaccinated and unvaccinated people, the data is broken down by age group.

That's it, have fun exploring the data!

moderate.title: Line Chart with Min/Max Ranges
moderate.text:
This is a line chart. The line shows the mean COVID case count and the shaded areas indicate the range (min/max) of the underlying data.

The orange line represents unvaccinated people; the blue line represents vaccinated people.

Your turn: Hover over the line chart to see the data for the corresponding date.

moderate.title: Legend
moderate.text:
This is the legend, showing the colors for vaccinated (blue) and unvaccinated (orange) folks.

That's it, have fun exploring the data!
